abstract: WestLB, the German state-owned bank based in Düsseldorf, said it would report a full-year loss of more than 100 million euros ($145 million) because of “persistently difficult market developments.” The lender will post a pretax “low three-digit million euro loss,” in contrast to an original forecast of a profit, according to a statement. The company, which is scheduled to publish nine-month earnings on Dec. 6, blamed “the substantial price losses of structured securities in the past weeks.”.

lead_paragraph: WestLB, the German state-owned bank based in Düsseldorf, said it would report a full-year loss of more than 100 million euros ($145 million) because of “persistently difficult market developments.” The lender will post a pretax “low three-digit million euro loss,” in contrast to an original forecast of a profit, according to a statement. The company, which is scheduled to publish nine-month earnings on Dec. 6, blamed “the substantial price losses of structured securities in the past weeks.”

headline.main: Germany: Bank to Post a Huge Loss
headline.print_headline: Germany: Bank To Post a Huge Loss
